snippet: Ms. Burns, 57, will become the chairwoman of a newly formed document technology company. Xerox said it was searching for chief executives for both of its new companies.
abstract: Xerox announces chief executive Ursula M Burns will not remain head of Xerox when it splits in two later in 2016; Burns will instead become chairwoman of newly formed document technology company.
lead_paragraph: Ms. Burns, 57, will become the chairwoman of a newly formed document technology company. Xerox said it was searching for chief executives for both of its new companies.

headline.main: Ursula M. Burns Will Not Be Chief Executive of Xerox After Split
headline.print_headline: Xerox Chief to Go to Spinoff Company
